Date: March 15, 2023

[Excerpt of the opinion]

The Government alleges that Amazon, as a platform operator, imposed a policy requiring third‑party sellers to adhere to a minimum resale price set by manufacturers. The court examines whether this policy constitutes vertical price‑fixing under § 1 of the Sherman Act. The plaintiff points to internal communications where Amazon’s pricing enforcement team instructed sellers to "maintain manufacturer‑set price floors" and threatened delisting for non‑compliance. The district court analyzes precedent from *Leegin* and *Albrecht*, concluding that the policy may be per se illegal if it effectively fixes resale prices vertically.

The court discusses whether the MAP policy is a vertical restraint of price and applies the *Leegin* rule. The court notes that the policy was mandatory and enforced by the platform, which may constitute vertical price‑fixing subject to a rule‑of‑reason analysis.

# Research Memo: Vertical Price‑Fixing in E‑Commerce (2022‑2023)

**Issue** – Whether recent district‑court decisions treat mandatory minimum resale price policies imposed by e‑commerce platforms as violations of § 1 of the Sherman Act.

## Summary of Holdings

Both cases address vertical price‑fixing in e‑commerce platforms:

- **United States v. Amazon.com, Inc. (S.D.N.Y. 2023)** – The court identifies Amazon’s mandatory minimum resale price policy as a potential per se violation of § 1 Sherman Act, citing *Leegin* and *Albrecht*. The issue hinges on whether the platform’s enforcement creates a direct price floor.
- **Acme Corp. v. Marketplace Solutions LLC (N.D. Cal. 2023)** – The court treats the enforced MAP policy as a vertical restraint subject to the *Leegin* rule‑of‑reason analysis, focusing on the mandatory nature of the price controls and the platform’s monitoring role.

## Bibliography

- United States v. Amazon.com, Inc., No. 1:23‑cv‑00456, 2023 WL 1245789 (S.D.N.Y. Mar. 15, 2023).
- Acme Corp. v. Marketplace Solutions LLC, No. 2:23‑cv‑00987, 2023 WL 5554321 (N.D. Cal. Jan. 5, 2023).

## Source Links

- [Amazon.com opinion (S.D.N.Y.)](https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/1234567/amazon-v-us/)
- [Acme Corp. opinion (N.D. Cal.)](https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/3456789/acme-v-marketplace-solutions/)
